events.title: Galileo Galilei's Trial and Recantation
events.description: Galileo Galilei was forced by the Roman Catholic Church to recant his support for heliocentrism, the astronomical model that places the Sun at the center of the universe.
events.significance: This event marked a significant conflict between science and religious doctrine, influencing the development of scientific inquiry and freedom of thought.

events.title: Battle of Waterloo Ends
events.description: On June 22, 1815, the Coalition forces under the Duke of Wellington and Prussian Field Marshal Bl√ºcher secured victory over Napoleon, officially ending the Napoleonic Wars.
events.significance: This battle marked the defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte, leading to a reshaping of European politics and power structures for decades.

events.title: Operation Barbarossa Begins
events.description: Nazi Germany launched Operation Barbarossa, the largest military invasion in history, targeting the Soviet Union during World War II.
events.significance: This marked a pivotal turning point in WWII, opening the Eastern Front and significantly impacting the course of the war.

events.title: Vichy's French State Relinquishes Power
events.description: Following the Allied invasion of Normandy, the Vichy government effectively lost control over France, leading to the restoration of the French Republic.
events.significance: This transition signaled the end of collaborationist government in France and the re-establishment of democratic governance after Nazi occupation.

events.title: East and West Germany Agree on Reunification
events.description: East and West Germany agreed to reunify after over four decades of division following World War II.
events.significance: This event marked a major milestone in European history, ending Cold War divisions and leading to the modern nation-state of Germany.
